intro: Draba tolucensis, commonly known as the Tolucan whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Draba tolucensis is a short-lived perennial, often found in areas with limited soil nutrients.
